website_summaries.verdict: Known for manufacturing quality tactical gear for generations, Gerber has put its expert workmanship in the Impromptu pen, earning it the top spot.
pros: Tough machined steel housing, practical pen function, and dependable glass breaker
Writing function works in wet or dry conditions
cons: Some complaints that it's heavy, but that's also a testament to its solid build

customer_reviews.title: Not a window breaker.
customer_reviews.text: I have always loved rite in the rain, that will always have a 5 star for me. The pen as a window breaker is horrible. I responded to a rollover, tried to break the window to get to the occupant of the vehicle, the car window knocked the metal glass breaker tip further into the pen and smushed the tip of the pen. Can't use it as a window breaker and now it won't even click to use as a heavy duty pen.
customer_reviews.author: teufelhunden217

customer_reviews.title: Made in the USA, great writing instrument!
customer_reviews.text: Great pen! Love that it's a clicky pen instead of a twist or capped. The size is perfect, same size as the Pilot G-2 that I normally use, just heavier. The only reason I give it four stars is the clicky button would stick almost every time I would use it at first...had to work it and put a dab of white lithium grease on it before it would work flawlessly. The Write in the Rain ink cartridge works great, I do prefer gel ink over ballpoint but this works great. The best part is the pen is made in the USA!!!
customer_reviews.author: William D.

customer_reviews.title: Great law enforcement duty pen!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great law enforcement uniform pen. Top clicking pens that are also tactical are hard to find! This one looks great in my pocket and the fact that it is also a glass breaking tool is paramount when time is of the essence. It’s not bulky at all. I was worried that it would It fitness next to my cuff key tool and they look good side by side in the shirt pocket. I highly recommend this for patrol officers.
customer_reviews.author: Taylor

customer_reviews.title: The tip unscrews too easily on its own.
customer_reviews.text: This is the second one of these I’ve owned. Both times they became useless in the same way. The tip with the glass breaker that screws into the pen to hold the ink in place, easily unscrewed by itself through wear and tear. Losing that tip makes your own useless. After the first mishap with this problem I decided to try it a second time. Same darn thing happened. I don’t recommend this pen for anything more than holding something g cool tactical looking.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew Page

customer_reviews.title: Great as a rattle, not as a pen
customer_reviews.text: Got in in the mail and within a few days, the pen would rattle when I wrote. It had something to do with the clicking mechanism. I sent it to Gerber directly for a warranty repair. They sent me a new one. Within a few days again, rattle rattle rattle. Now my return window is closed and I have an expensive paperweight. Don't waste your money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: JUNK... Broke on the first drop!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this pen about 10 months ago. Dropped it for the first time tonight at work from waist level to the concrete by accident and the pen will NOT function properly anymore. It’s broken and not useable. What a waste of $50!!!! This was supposed to last me forever and it’s going in the garbage after less than a year. Extremely disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Hardgrave

customer_reviews.title: You can do better.
customer_reviews.text: This a very nice pen in some ways. It looks nice and feels good in the hand but the glass breaker is located rite at the tip of the pen very distracting but the one thing that I don't understand is the clicker is very cheap you have to play with it to get it to work.If a $2.00 bic pen works so well $50.00 gerber should be perfect I'm not going to try and fix it the engineers at gerber need to before they sell it to us.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Velte

customer_reviews.title: I have a LOT of Gerber gear but...
customer_reviews.text: This is the second pen I received from Amazon. The first pen came DOA with the clicker not working so the pen wouldn't deploy or retract. Amazon quickly sent me another and it's worked for 6 months just fine and I use it daily. About a week and a half ago I went to use it and it no longer deploys. I was hoping it was something simple but the clicker mechanism is stuck and/or is very rough and doesn't deploy the pen properly. Unfortunately, I had to put in a warranty claim with Gerber.
customer_reviews.author: patrick

customer_reviews.title: great to write the wrongs
customer_reviews.text: this pen feels like you are writing with bold, uncompromising intention. at nearly a quarter pound the weight of your convictions are in this pen. if you are ever at an atm signing that check you wish to deposit and some unfortunate individual attempts an unsolicited aggression on your person you will want to have this in hand. with the proper application of this pen to vital or not so vital parts you can achieve the desired results. i personally recommend humanely retracting the pen portion so as not to needlessly administer ink to a person or persons internal organs. enjoy writing like a champ!
customer_reviews.author: Mark V.

customer_reviews.title: This pen is awesome, handy, solid, always at the ready.  Well made piece of kit!
customer_reviews.text: This pen is solid steel. It is heavy, but it doesn't weigh you down. I carry it in a shirt pocket of my uniform shirt. It comes with a cartridge that writes upside down or on wet paper to a degree. I'm very pleased with this pen. I've had other aluminum versions of a tactical pen before. This one is so handy because you don't have to remove the cap to use it. It functions perfectly, no trouble extending the pen tip or retracting with a click of the top button. Best made tactical pen I've owned. My wife carries a different brand that is aluminum because she says her purse is heavy enough as it is.
customer_reviews.author: George S.

customer_reviews.title: Meh, ok tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: Cool feature to not have to post a tactical pen and have that retracting refill, the only issue is I wear 5.11 tactical pants and keep this pen in a little side pocket, it is constantly becoming undone and when I take out my pen for use, there goes my spring and refill. I ended up giving this pen to my son, the concept was great but not worth the extra effort to put everything back together again. Perhaps some locktite could have fixed the problem but at this price point a design flaw. I would not recommend for anyone active.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best tactile pen ever
customer_reviews.text: Price is too high but I wanted it so badly that I did it. Everyday front shirt pocket carry for me. Relatively Very heavy but I love it. wish I had a spare for my work vehicle (I'm a geologist). The day after its arrival I thought I may need it on a landslide with car wrecks, but emergency response personnel had their own glass breakers. So far no holes worn in my pocket from the Extended breaker point. My kids will be getting one for personal protection when they go to college. Built like a tank. No issues so far with pushbutton action as widely reported.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I own a variety of brand name tactical pens and this one is by far the best!
customer_reviews.text: I own a bunch of tactical pens and by far this one is the best. I've been using my pen for about 2 months now and realized I love that it's a click style retractable pen. You basically use it to write all the time that's the main reason why you buy a tac PEN. You don't want to be unscrewing the cap off all the time when you got to write like on those other pens. That's why I only use this as an EDC. It writes smoothly, even works under water, It is also very solid if you have to defend yourself or in need to break glass.
customer_reviews.author: Pete

customer_reviews.title: Indestructible!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is indestructible! I’ve seen guys come in after being blown up and the pen would still be in one piece and able to write. Often it would be the only piece of gear that was salvageable. I had to get one for myself! Space pen replacements fit perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun McHalffey

customer_reviews.title: seriously sturdy
customer_reviews.text: I am a firefighter/mechanic/maintenance worker. I break things. This pen is carried in a small tool pouch on my hip as I crawl under trucks into tight spaces etc. It is extremely sturdy. It writes well even in wet conditions and upside down. I would not recommend for someone who writes extensively as it is quite heavy for a pen, but if you need a seriously tough, reliable pen, this fits the bill nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Purchaser of many things

customer_reviews.title: Good weapon. Bad pen.
customer_reviews.text: This is a sturdy pen, that would probably do me well in any street fights, or if I needed to smash a window to get out of a burning car. Very hefty. Unfortunately, the clicker was junk. It either wouldn't put the pen out, or it wouldn't retract. Or it would retract while I was writing. As I am 99.9% unlikely to use this in case one or two above, but 100% likely to need this for writing, back it went.
customer_reviews.author: Stuck in CA

customer_reviews.title: My 2nd one
customer_reviews.text: My first one was definitely 4 stars. I changed the ink cartridge to the recommended one when the original ran out of ink. Once I did that, whenever I clicked it, it got stuck and wouldn't work. Then I lost the pen.... :( My replacement one is great! I love that its a clicker. The glass breaker on the tip is reassurance that a strike point will always be there. Heft is great. Writes hella smooth. Build quality on my replacement is excellent; 5 stars for this one.
customer_reviews.author: Live-Laugh-Love

customer_reviews.title: Clip broke
customer_reviews.text: *Update - a week after I gave my husband this pen for our anniversary, the clip snapped off of it. He keeps it clipped to the outer pocket of his laptop case, and as he was pulling the pen out of the pocket the clasp snapped. Now it has a jagged edge and is no longer convenient to keep with him. I'm pretty disappointed, as it seemed to be a quality pen. *Original review - Better than expected. The pen is solid and has a good weight to it without being too heavy. It is perfect to keep as a self defense item that is discreet.
customer_reviews.author: ABL

customer_reviews.title: Would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: I drive a tow truck and use this with the 'Rite in the Rain' ink cartridges to fill out paperwork. Have used it in rain, snow and everything in between. I use it everyday for a decent amount of paperwork and three cartridges of ink have lasted me well over a year. I've dropped it several times on concrete, dirt, etc and have had no problems with it writing as well as unscrewing to refill the cartridges. Very happy I bought it and would suggest to anyone that has to write in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Nate

customer_reviews.title: Pen that will last forever
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy. Nice weight.space pen refill. Clicker sticks when new.A drop of oil on clicker shaft and a couple dozen clicks will take care of this problem. A drop of low strength loctite required for end that opens, or you might lose it. comes loose easily. Pen should last forever if you dont loose it. Worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth Smith

customer_reviews.title: I had to edit my review.
customer_reviews.text: I wrote a positive review when it first came in, now after months of use I need to edit it. The clip ended up bending so it no longer stays securely clipped to my jean pocket. One other thing was I needed to constantly tighten the cap at the writing end almost daily. It would just loosen on it's own. That I got use to but the clip that bent made it to where I could no longer carry the pen securely. I REALLY wanted to love this pen.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Larson

customer_reviews.title: Poor design
customer_reviews.text: I am in the military, and was looking for a good tactical pen. I have had/used this pen for three days, and the window punch has already fallen out (lost due to how small it is). The pen writes great (for $45), but if you had any thoughts of using the window punch at some point, I would not buy.
customer_reviews.author: Shea

customer_reviews.title: Poorly designed bolt
customer_reviews.text: Pen stopped retracting after about a year of light use after gradually getting more difficult over time. The mechanism grinds down little bits of metal and wears out and can't be fixed. Makes the pen worthless unless you relish ink stains on your pocket.
customer_reviews.author: M. Perry

customer_reviews.title: Excellent pen
customer_reviews.text: Great pen, click mechanism works well, pen is solid, and has a nice weight to it. Not too heavy and not too light. Fits perfectly in the pen holder of the Gerber Customfit Dual Sheath [30-001223]. I wanted red ink, so I ordered 3 Pack Fisher Space Pen Red Ink Refills SPR2 Medium Tip and they fit perfectly. These ink refills write nicely too.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: One solid pen you must have
customer_reviews.text: I use this pen regularly. The click mechanism works great and has help up very well. I like the ability to try different inserts. Sometimes the glass breaker throws me off while writing. It is definitely a conversation piece and people are surprised at the weight when they first hold it. If you want one hell of a solid built pen you need to pull the trigger on the Gerber impromptu
customer_reviews.author: Bryan C Reed

customer_reviews.title: A solid tactical piece.
customer_reviews.text: A solid tactical piece. I work at an airport, and pass through security many times a day. So far, it hasn't raised any eyebrows, so it seems safe. It's solid construction and weight coupled with the glass breaker tip make it a good quick grab defense. It would be a solid defense/offense for a striking or piercing blow, and the 2oz weight would add some serious 'Oomph' to a punch if held in your hand. It writes relatively smoothly, but I keep it as a backup pen in my back pocket, and use another pen as my main writing instrument. If you're security or tactically minded, it's worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JymmyTheSaint

customer_reviews.title: Great for contractors with one minor flaw
customer_reviews.text: best pen I have ever had as a contractor, the only reason I didnt give it 5 stars is the clip snaps and gerber does not respond to the issue. How do you create such a bulletproof pen and put a garbage clip on it. For anyone having trouble with the button just reinstall after rotating it sometimes its sticks but once you reinstall its works great really a non issue.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: 2 year ownership review
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this pen now for almost 2 years. I use it daily. I have not had to change out the ink yet, still on the original. I am on a fire dept. and durning training, this pen has broken a lot of glass. It is a very impressive pen. It does take a little getting used to for a day or two. Update 11-28-17 3rd year and still going strong. On 2nd ink refill and still using daily. The tip no longer is black from using the glass breaker on windows during extrication training. Lots of glass broken.
customer_reviews.author: Randel

customer_reviews.title: Great, but the clicker does have a problem
customer_reviews.text: Like other reviewers, I have experienced the clicker getting stuff and its frustrating to have this happen on a $40 pen. Otherwise, I love everything about the pen...the weight, the grip, the clip, and the look. I rotate this and my nightcore pen, but honestly I like the Gerber better simply because I don't have to screw the top off. Just wish they would fix that clicker!
customer_reviews.author: Adam Shaw

customer_reviews.title: Nice, manly pen :)
customer_reviews.text: We have now purchased three (3) of these pens. My husband was pulled over one night and the sherriff had one and he loved it, not usually what you walk away from these stories with, but I ordered his that same night from my phone... Subsequently my father ended up with one as a father's day gift and a close family friend as a birthday! It heavy, useful and seems to write reasonably well, although I get the feeling that is not their primary reason for wanting them!
customer_reviews.author: Smit

customer_reviews.title: Right Size
customer_reviews.text: This is the right size for a heavy duty pin. It has the right amount of weight but isn't too heavy. After several moths of daily carry and use, it still looks brand new (even after dropping it a few times). It does take some getting use to as you have to hold it a certain way or the glass breaker will get in the way of writing. The clip is indexed to prevent this.
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: Things a beast
customer_reviews.text: Dropped it on the tip and the cartridge became stuck because the tip was dented in. I used a rat tail file to clean the hole and its worked fine since. Very heavy but feels like a great weapon in hand.
customer_reviews.author: Randy

customer_reviews.title: You get what you pay for
customer_reviews.text: This is such a cool pen. Sure it cost a ton of money. But it does the job it was built to do. There are ton of other pens like this or look similar But they are knock offs. And dissappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence W. Lipman

customer_reviews.title: People won't forgetfully steal it
customer_reviews.text: A small learning curve until its comfortable due to the weight, afterwards its a dream. If you're like me and runs pens out or eventually breaks them, this pet will survive and be beautifully worn. The 'glass breaker' also works well for drawing 0.6" diameter circles, cutting paper, and acting as a scribe. There's few durable/premium pens out there with a regular push button design and even though I wish Gerber would make a titanium one (I'd drop +$100 to get that) the steel works well.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Gallagher

customer_reviews.title: Solid Pen
customer_reviews.text: Ive always been a fan of unique pens. A friend said he had purchased a tactical pen and I thought Id buy one to see what they were all about. This is one of the few I found that functions a a traditional ballpoint with a retractable cartridge as opposed to having to remove a cap to use the pen. It is quite heavy and also has a permanently extended tip that can be used for glass breaking. Overall writes quite well and functions well as everyday pen though I would be careful about traveling with it in checked on luggage. Not sure the TSA would approve.
customer_reviews.author: Sean Keefer

customer_reviews.title: Clicky tops are the best
customer_reviews.text: Wanted a heavy duty pen, and this one is exactly that. None of the gimmicky garbage that a lot of the pens have and most importantly for me it's a clicky top. My only concern was that glass breaker would require repositioning the pen to write but it seems to be fine even facing the paper due to its small size. Only way to improve it would be offer an aluminum version as it gets a little heavy if you're writing a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Camoscrubs1234!

customer_reviews.title: It's durable.
customer_reviews.text: I think I overpaid for the brand name. I expected the window breaker to be spring loaded. Its just an added tip protruding off the side of the pen. Has a durable clip more appropriate for pants pocket than shirt pocket.
customer_reviews.author: Sabot

customer_reviews.title: Good pen and weapon, minor issues
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pen and carry it daily. I did lubricate the button as it was a little rough at first. It writes well and has a good weight. The glass breaker is a small pin that extends out of the tip of the pen. For some people it gets in the way when they try to write with it. A right handed person will need the pocket clip pointed away from you to write unless you hold the pen almost vertical. If it operated smoothly out of the box and the glass breaking tip was just a little shorter I would have given it 5 stare
customer_reviews.author: Scott Warga

customer_reviews.title: Didn't want to like it--thought it was cheesy--got it as part of a ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't want to like it--thought it was cheesy--got it as part of a set. REALLY glad I got it. The craftsmanship on this part of the set is very nice, and inspires confidence. (Id would be nice if the glass breaker was removable though)
customer_reviews.author: Ashley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: Really like the feel and weight of this tactical pen. I've traveled with it for a few months in my computer bag. No problem. However, this week I had it clipped into the breast pocket of my sportcoat and airport security took it away. So, know that is possible. Sorry to lose it.
customer_reviews.author: Alden Globe

customer_reviews.title: Clicker A Big Disappointment
customer_reviews.text: The pen feels solid and gives you the feeling of at least having "something" when forced to go into places where I have to disarm. Unfortunately, as many have noted on here, the clicker on this pen is a sick joke. Gerber owes it to their customers to fix this chronic and very common problem with this item. That or discontinue its production altogether. I hope for the former but being that it has gone on this long, will not be holding my breath.
customer_reviews.author: Raymond I.

customer_reviews.title: Good gear, one complaint
customer_reviews.text: Good pen, nice and sturdy. (I can be pretty tough on pens, I've even managed to break other manufacturers' "tactical" pens!) Unlike some cheaper models, it is not so fat that it won't fit in a shirt-pocket pen slot. The glass breaker point is a visual distraction, but does not interfere with writing. The "click" is not very positive, though, which is a bit of a disappointment, and why I only give it 4 stars. I keep checking to see whether the point is extended or retracted, there is very little tactile feedback.
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Quality issue poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: Lasted me 10 months then clicker stuck tried oil etc no luck . Emailed Gerber customer service never heard back $60.00 down the tube
customer_reviews.author: J  Van Buren

customer_reviews.title: It's purdy
customer_reviews.text: I love the way this pen feels in my hand. It's super heavy and made of steel or whatever and just feels amazing to journal with. Im sure snobs will roll their eyes and say "jUst uSe a fOunAtin pEn". No. This doesn't have the prettiest ink but it's a joy to hold and to use. It's great that i can use it to escape from a car window in a pinch, though i'll likely never use it for that. This pen would be perfect if i could find a gel ink cartridge that fits it... oh well. :(
customer_reviews.author: K P

customer_reviews.title: Excellent tactical pen.
customer_reviews.text: This has some serious weight to it. It has a very nice grip in my hands.I have seen several cheaper/generic ones that are made of aluminium and painted it black which in their definition makes it a tactical pen.. those pens have no grip and I am not sure they are strong enough to protect you. This one should do everything that you expect it to do as a Tactical Pen. My only concern is that one of these days the glass breaker tip will make a hole in my jeans. So far, that hasn't happened yet.
customer_reviews.author: Technical_Steak

customer_reviews.title: Great for everyday use
customer_reviews.text: Arrived a few days early and in perfect condition. Excellent weight and balance, writes smoothly, and is very comfortable in the hand. It's perfect for everyday use, doesn't look like a weaponized pen so it doesn't attract attention, and the refills are easily available. Considering buying another as a spare in case I ever lose or misplace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Act162This

customer_reviews.title: This is a very nice pen. If you're looking for classic style
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice pen. If you're looking for classic style, this is not the pen for you. This is a heavy, tactical pen. It can break glass, and it it does it quite well. It writes in wet environment, it writes upside down. In a pinch, can be used as a weapon for self defense, and will take down your assailant if you know the soft spots, lol. Very versatile writing tool, especially for law enforcement/EMT/EMS personnel who need a pen that won't quit under varying conditions. A little pricey, but made by Gerber in USA. They make excellent knives.
customer_reviews.author: GoldtopSam

customer_reviews.title: Great pen
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as more of a talking point but noticed it’s a very comfortable pen to write with. It fits in my uniform pocket perfectly and is “noticeable “ as not to forget it. Nicely machining and is anodized
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: ONE MANLY PEN THAT SAYS I DO NOT TAKE CRAP FROM ANYONE
customer_reviews.text: This is one rugged and tough pen. Just to hold it you feel like you have a tactical advantage. Anyone that borrows this pen will know they are in the presence of greatness when they feel the weight. This is one Manly pen... HELL, I feel 10 feet tall and bullet proof with this pen in my possession – HooYAH!
customer_reviews.author: K. Jewell

customer_reviews.title: Glass breaker drags on paper
customer_reviews.text: Quite heavy, feels good in your hand. Writes well. Glass breaker does get in the way of writing, drags on the paper if you don't pick it up and hold it just right. I even tried to find a longer ink cartridge to mitigate this issue but alas, no use. Pen itself is a good weapon, glass breaker works great.
customer_reviews.author: MissouriFamily

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, but not the greatest to write with.
customer_reviews.text: It’s very sturdy, I use it as part of my EDC. It’s not the easiest to write with, but that’s not the reason I got it in the first place. If you’re looking for a “back up” pen but as a useful EDC (glass breaker/self-defense) this pen is not a bad choice.
customer_reviews.author: JVR

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Tac Pen
customer_reviews.text: Nice weight and balance, writes nicely, really like the clicker. After using it for more than a week know I have to say I really like it, I was a little concerned about the clicker cause it felt kinda gritty when I first got it but know it smoothed right out. I was kinda put off by the price at first, I'm not cheap and I have my fair share of expensive pens but I must say that it worth what I paid. Update: Will need to send in for warranty work due to thumb clicker no longer works and jams, it did serve me well for a couple of years since buying it.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Gladieux

customer_reviews.title: Mechanism sucks!
customer_reviews.text: I really like this pen. It's got a nice weight. It writes wonderfully. The mechanism SUCKS!!!!! It regularly gets hung up. Drives me nuts. I've tried a spray lubricant multiple times. Helps maybe a little bit. I constantly have trouble with it locking up.
customer_reviews.author: UMA

customer_reviews.title: Heavier than most, better than all its kind.
customer_reviews.text: Writes in every condition I have needed it to. Cold and/or wet. This is my second one so I have one in each car. Michigan weather in the winter, writes like a charm even when the car sits in freezing overnight weather. One item to keep in mind. The glass breaker tip may not work out with your writing style.
customer_reviews.author: Henry  Kubin

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This pen is AWESOME! Look no further, you have found the only pen you need. There aren't any screws in the clip to come loose. This pen is the perfect weight, lenght and feel; sturdiness abounds! I love this pen and I have been using it for four months now with no issues. There are cheaper pens and cheaper is what you will get! Buy this pen and you will not be sorry!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Blizzard

customer_reviews.title: good tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: This is the first Gerber product that I actually like. It writes very smooth and easily, it took me some time to get used to the glass breaker due to it always sticking out. I like the clicker, it's so much better than dealing with a screw off cap of the other tactical pen I have used in the past. I guess the one negative thing I would have to about it, it's that the pocket clip is not beefy enuff in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: David LaCure

customer_reviews.title: Great Gift for Men
customer_reviews.text: I gifted this for my dad. He loves it!! He is a business owner therefore carries it everywhere in his chest pocket and gets compliments over it all the time.
customer_reviews.author: David & Nuvia

customer_reviews.title: I like the pen
customer_reviews.text: I like the pen. It writes nicely. I have had it for a while now. However as a FF I liked the idea of having a glass breaker. The problem is the glass breaker doesn't work. I tried it during vehicle extrication training when we were cutting up a Volvo. Doesn't work.
customer_reviews.author: Kristofer

customer_reviews.title: Nice looking and feeling pen, but mine shouldn’t have passed QC
customer_reviews.text: Like the pen okay, and writes well, but is a little “off”. At least on mine, if you fully screw on the tip, the pen becomes nearly impossible to actuate. You have to slightly unscrew the tip to be able to click the pen. :/
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Stasel

customer_reviews.title: Discrete, dependable.
customer_reviews.text: The particular characteristics of this tactical pen are not met by the other options offered by the competition. Appropriate size, not too thick, solid but not excessively heavy, properly designed center of gravity allows for a comfortable grip while writing and the glass breaker is discrete enough. I’m satisfied with my choice.
customer_reviews.author: Joseloy

customer_reviews.title: Great gift for my dad!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dad as a gift. He travels extensively for work, and sometimes visits places where he needs an all-weather all-angle writing tool. These locations are usually fairly remote, and occasionally dangerous. The glass breaking capacity is a feature I found cool because a pen is something my dad will keep on his person at all times, and thus could help him in the case of a bad vehicle accident. I was thrilled with this purchase because it looks really cool, it's made by Gerber, and it will serve multiple purposes in my dad's travels. I cannot vouch yet for how it works as an actual pen.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Miley

customer_reviews.title: Great pen for the money.
customer_reviews.text: It's a good, high quality pen. I was a bit taken aback by the ever present glass breaker at first, but it doesn't interfere with writing. So far the pen itself is holding up well, compared to some other pens that had the exterior coating flake away after a day or two of use. The Rite in Rain cartridge holds up to the promise of writing in all sorts of adverse conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Faloi

customer_reviews.title: great pen one major problem
customer_reviews.text: Nice pen writes well and feels good in your hand the only huge draw back is the glass breaker point is at the bottom of the writing portion of the pen and when you carry it in a pocket it will rip clothing. Hugh problem for a great pen. nothing else to say but it defeats the purpose if you have an issue carrying this in your pocket or shirt and don't want to wear a pocket protector. hope this helps
customer_reviews.author: Magtech

customer_reviews.title: Extremely robust build
customer_reviews.text: A trustworthy companion who can withstand your toughest adventures. To quite an extent, the more you beat it up, the better it looks. Update: after 1 solid year of service, a 1 meter falling impact has made the pen malfunctional.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Yuhan Luo

customer_reviews.title: and this one is quickly becoming a favorite because of it's size and ease of use
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband to use at work. We now own a few different tactical pens, and this one is quickly becoming a favorite because of it's size and ease of use. Unlike some other tactical pens that are bordering on comical for size, this one blends in with other everyday pens. The pen clicks into place, so no screwing a cap on and off. The pen has a quality weight and feel to it as well.
customer_reviews.author: ZDoc

customer_reviews.title: A bit on the heavy side
customer_reviews.text: I found this pen to be a bit unbalanced while writing. I tried it out for a few days but it wasn't for me. If you want a heavy pen, this is the ticket. Glass breaker is a mall ninja-ey touch. Looks pretty cool too.
customer_reviews.author: R. Guzman

customer_reviews.title: One of the best pens I've owned
customer_reviews.text: Great tactical pen! It has a nice weight behind it, which I like in a tactical pen, but still light enough to write comfortably as an actually pen. Many reviews show a problem with the "clicker" when they first get it, saying it gets stuck. I've had mine for only 24 hours so far, it did stick the first 2 or 3 times when I first got it, but I took it apart one time. Took the tip off, took the ink cartridge out, unscrewed the "clicker" button. Put it all back together and clicked it about 20 times in a row and it works perfect. No sticking at all now. One if the best pens I've owned
customer_reviews.author: Jake

customer_reviews.title: You must be sure the glass breaking tip is up when you write, or it will destroy the paper.
customer_reviews.text: This is great as an on or off duty defensive weapon, great for breaking glass. The pens writes in any position. I liked it so much, I bought one for another officer.
customer_reviews.author: Charles L.

customer_reviews.title: Poor quality, useless for breaking windows.
customer_reviews.text: The window breaker function was completely useless. When used in a training exercise, the window breaker tip flattened and broke without breaking the window. I tried the same window with a colleague's window-breaking tool, and shattered the window in one hit. Moreover, the pen mechanism broke after striking the window, so I couldn't even use the pen for writing anymore. I expected much more from a company with Gerber's reputation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bulletproof Pen
customer_reviews.text: This has been my everyday carry pen for over a year and have not had to change the ink cartridge yet. I use it almost every day and writes great. It does have some heft to it and that's probably part of the reason why I haven't lost it yet. I've gotten used to the weight of it in my pocket and I always check for it. I've also taken it flying, and have never had an issue with TSA regarding it.
customer_reviews.author: EDCGuy

customer_reviews.title: It's a fine pen, with a nice sense of heft in ...
customer_reviews.text: It's a fine pen, with a nice sense of heft in your hand. I have yet to use it tactically, so I can't speak to that function, but it certainly feels nice to write with. One quibble though: while the Fisher Space Pen refills fit just fine, they're a bit wobbly, which detracts from the experience. Despite buying a Fisher refill specifically for this pen, I ended up not using it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Pemulis

customer_reviews.title: Heavy pen 😝
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the pen is great. But the ink could be better than what it is. Very disappointed with that
customer_reviews.author: De La Cruz

customer_reviews.title: Well built TSA allowed tactical pen
customer_reviews.text: Well built and feels good in the hand. Pen is very well constructed, heavy enough that you know its in your hand and hands weight to a closed fist. Writes well, the small glass breaker does not interfere with writing. Passes through TSA with no problems!
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: This pen will not let you down.
customer_reviews.text: Awesome pen. I use it on a daily basis. It stands up to being in my back pocket riding around in a rough terrain forklift all day. I loved it so much that when I lost it, I ordered another one.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Solid and very useful
customer_reviews.text: This pen really does do it all. We had bought this pen as a Christmas gift for my boyfriend's brothers and cousin but after seeing it in person, he had to have one himself! He loves that it can write upside down and under water. He also loves the heavy feel to it and the great polished look. He uses it at all of his business meetings and says he gets at least a couple people a day asking about it. The tactical portions are great if he ever needs them, but for now the look and sturdiness make it worthwhile!
customer_reviews.author: Tarra Gluss

customer_reviews.title: This is the pen you probably want
customer_reviews.text: I was hesitant but bought this anyway. I have to say, I'm impressed how well it writes. The pen deploys easily. The glass breaker hasn't gotten in the way yet when writing but is still present if needed. If you're looking for a tactical pen this is probably the one you want.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Useful, simple, sturdy EDC tool
customer_reviews.text: This tactical pen writes well, while being a nice, substantial-feeling weight. I also like that it is one-piece, rather than having a piece that can be easily lost. The glass breaker tip doesn't interfere with writing. This is a perfect, unobtrusive, EDC tool.
customer_reviews.author: KHoward

customer_reviews.title: The only pen to buy!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is this a great pen. You can use it for self defense, breaking a car window and scribe. It uses a RiteintheRain ink cartridge which is also a great product. This is the second one I Bought because I lost the first one. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Mind.of.Hutch

customer_reviews.title: Great tac pen
customer_reviews.text: Great tactical pen. I love that it is a push button as well I bought a second one when my first was stolen. I love that it also has a window breaker for your car as well. On top of all this it writes very well. With good flow and less skipping than i was expecting
customer_reviews.author: Thunder_Punching

customer_reviews.title: A Gerber you don't want on your hip/in your boot!
customer_reviews.text: Hands down a fantastic pen, better than the overpriced ones (that are over twice the price of this Gerber tactical pen)! Every bit as dependable, useful and practical. I'd buy this again, again and again - without a doubt! Thanks Gerber, looking forward to your next version!
customer_reviews.author: Randy C.

customer_reviews.title: Could have been great
customer_reviews.text: This product is well made, writes very well due to the space pen cartridge and possibly the weight. My only complaint is the glass breaker that is always poking out, darn thing has stabbed me through my safety vest and shirt whilst squatting to pick tools off the ground. Not to mention the writer must position the pen in a manner so this "glass breaker" does not impose mutilation to your writing surface. This product's price point, materials and craftsmanship earn it 3 stars...
customer_reviews.author: J E A

customer_reviews.title: The VERY BEST PEN in the World !
customer_reviews.text: I cannot praise this pen enough - I doubt I will ever use anything else...I was in the misfortune to working and was hit, (perhaps maliciously), which wedged the car another car and the truck that hit us...we need an immediate escape route and I had my Gerber with me, (brand new, only 3 days old), I used the toughened pointer to break the windshield and we all got out safely - later that day, I signed several forms with the same pen and thanked Gerber for making such a brilliant and super useful tool...absolutely World Class !
customer_reviews.author: Steve Pickering

customer_reviews.title: This is the "1911" of tactical pens
customer_reviews.text: It's a wonderful pen for a start - the glass-breaker, which is by the pen nib doesn't interfere with it, I love that its a "click" pen - but best of all (for me) its heavy steel and not a light alloy as so many are... some might find writing with a quite long, heavy pen tricky but if you have big enough hands the weight just feels so right - bit like my Glock and 1911 - both do the job but I love the weight of the 1911.
customer_reviews.author: Mournblade14

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: My husband got me this as a gift. I have to say it is nice and hefty and I enjoy writing with it. I have not yet had to get "tactical" on anybody yet but I feel confident this would hold up for multiple uses. The only thing I am not in love with the glass breaking device on the end. If you don't engage the pen before attempting to write (which we all do sometimes) than that piece can scratch up the paper. Still, I would buy it again regardless and suggest it to friends.
customer_reviews.author: Lynette Luria

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't write well under GOOD conditions let alone bad ones
customer_reviews.text: Pen function is worthless. It doesn't write well under GOOD conditions let alone bad ones. Haven't busted any glass yet so I don't know how well it will work. I'd look around at other options before I would buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: john p

customer_reviews.title: Not durable at all
customer_reviews.text: 1st real drop now the action is sticky and has having trouble opening and closeing lose really disappointed big waste of money
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must have
customer_reviews.text: Glad I made the purchase. It’s solid, durable and ready for any situation. A must have for edc to handle any situation that may arise.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Dope pen. You’ll like it, or you’re stupid.
customer_reviews.text: Tactical click pen. Pretty much the only one, but that doesn’t mean they skimped. It’s great. Uses write in the rain or space pen refills.
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin Nietupski

customer_reviews.title: Very Sturdy and Cool!
customer_reviews.text: Nice "clicky" pen. Very solid construction. I put a Fisher Space Pen cartridge in right away. I have the coolest pen at work.
customer_reviews.author: Nacho_b

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite pen, I take it everywhere with me (yes ...
customer_reviews.text: My new favorite pen, I take it everywhere with me (yes you can carry it on a plane if you are wondering). It is an excellent tool with a huge variety of purposes beyond a normal pen. I'm in the quality industry and use this for various hardness tests and etching applications. Worth the money, though you're hand may hurt the first few times using it because of the weight difference from a normal pen.
customer_reviews.author: Colton Halbach

customer_reviews.title: Great Self-Defense Pen
customer_reviews.text: Seems very sturdy and the clicking feature is great. Gerber comes through again. The only weird thing is that there is a metal point for self-defense near the tip of the pen which sometimes interferes with writing.
customer_reviews.author: Greg Wolak

customer_reviews.title: Good EDC pen
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a good tactical pen to carry every day. This one is perfect because it’s a click pen as opposed to one you have to take apart to use. Worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Talley

customer_reviews.title: It rattles when sriting.
customer_reviews.text: This is my 3rd gerber pen. Only is issue is that when I write with the last one it rattles. The button does not remain tight in writing mode and clicks around while writing or moving. The previous remained tight and silent even during writing mode. A hassle to return so will put up with it, but will reconsider giving them out as gifts to clients and customers.
customer_reviews.author: Reed Schneider

customer_reviews.title: First Gerber product I have had that was a disappointment..
customer_reviews.text: Had to replace ink refill when first received. Glass break point disappeared after about one month. First Gerber product I have had that was a disappointment..
customer_reviews.author: AZ

customer_reviews.title: Hopeful the next one works properly. - Update
customer_reviews.text: This was just delivered, and I'm so disappointed. The box was open, the pen wasn't in the package correctly, and the actual writing pen does not click. It won't stay down so that you are able to write. I will be returning. With all the severe flooding where I live, I was excited to get this in order to keep in my vehicle while traveling. ***Update*** Replacing this was a dream. Free UPS pickup, the new one shipped before UPS picked up the broken one, and I had the new one in two days.
customer_reviews.author: Ak

customer_reviews.title: If you want a battle ready pen, this is for you.
customer_reviews.text: This pen is no joke. It is solid stainless steel with a carbide window breaker. It is heavy and built for battle. The clicker is even precision machined and not just a plastic part, it is all stainless steel. I like a heavy pen to write with and this fits the bill. The ink is the Fisher space pen ink so it will write anywhere.
customer_reviews.author: RHall1

customer_reviews.title: Great pen
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pen purchased, the first had issues with the clicker mechanism after about a year of use, dropping it, etc. The new pen seems to be an updated version as the clicker is much smoother, the finish is slightly different, and the fluting towards the tip of the pen is narrower. I highly recommend this pen for daily use, but if your prone to dropping things, like I am, be prepared to purchase extra refills, as a drop to the tip always requires a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron B

customer_reviews.title: Good Pen, Poor tactical pen...
customer_reviews.text: Writes great, but I dropped it once and the button to lower and raise the pen tip got stuck. This is suppose to be a tactical pen, i drop it 3ft while trying to put it back in my pocket in my pants and it breaks. Bought a Surefire pen and havent looked back.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Feels good in hand
customer_reviews.text: Quite heavy for its size due to being steel. Feels good in hand, the glass breaker tip doesn't protrude to where it interferes with writing, which was a concern of mine when ordering the pen. Unfortunately, the clicky stopped working within 5 minutes of opening the package. Maybe it was a lemon, but that doesn't inspire confidence. Item was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Sarcoblaster

customer_reviews.title: Great not perfect
customer_reviews.text: I want so badly to love this product... and frankly, I do. However, as many have reported the clicker is terrible. It always gets jammed and stuck in the out position. The only way to prevent this from happening is to basically jam the button super hard. I may open it up and try and fiddle with it
customer_reviews.author: Blake Campbell

product_meta.title: Gerber Impromptu Tactical Pen - Black [31-001880]
product_meta.description: Danger has a way of presenting itself when you least expect it. That’s why Gerber, in collaboration with law enforcement professionals, developed the Impromptu Tactical Pen. Sure, it’s a pen and it’ll serve to take notes like a good pen should, but it’s not your average writing implement. Made from machined steel with a tempered window-shattering tip design, the Impromptu Tactical Pen can be used to break a windshield or defend yourself from an unexpected attack.
feature_bullets: Rugged, machined steel body and stainless steel pocket clip keeps this pen handy
Rite in the Rain ink cartridge works in all conditions, inside and outdoors
Reliable push-button mechanism deploys ball point mechanism
Integrated glass-breaker tip features tempered steel and is designed to get you out of trouble

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,228 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S. Learn More
